inn1.comm: good length in the channel outside off, left alone
ducks in off a good length this time and Sharjeel stays in line and blocks
the slips have not noticed the inside edge and ask the question for a leg before. It was full and angled in. Sharjeel's feet don't move much as he defends, but he survives
132 kph, fullish and just outside off, this time he gets a long stride forward and defends
presses forward, but makes sure he accounts for the inward movement he's getting and drives the full length ball to mid-on
a bit too short on that occasion as he pulls from off stump to long leg
fullish and on the stumps, Sharjeel punches it down the ground
back of a length on middle and off, solidly defended to short cover
not quite short enough to pull and he learns that the hard way as he is beaten by a good length delivery angled across him. Very close to playing on there
straight bat answers this shortish delivery on off stump. His feet though were going leg side
looks to whip it away through the leg side, but can't connect with this full delivery on leg stump. Hint of inswing foils his shot
lovely strike! Hit on the up and this bursts through the cover field. Wasn't too bad a delivery as he probes just outside his off stump, but Sharjeel is forward and just caresses it
timed it well, as he usually does but he cannot find the gap, another usual occurrence. This was overpitched outside off and he leans into a cover drive. Can't beat the man in the circle
fuller and angled across him, Shehzad is forward and drills it straight to cover. Lovely punch for no run
137 kph, good length ball on the stumps, shuffles across and blocks down the pitch
137 kph, targets off stump and Shehzad is forward with a dead bat
not too much feet there to negotiate this back of a length delivery on off stump, defended into the covers
132 kph, shortish and angled across him, Shehzad is looks quite comfortable as he punches to mid-off

spectacular effort by the keeper as he dives to his right and took this and the umpire has not seen the batsman gloving it! Afghanistan went up in appeal, the bowler was certain he had his man. But to no avail though. Sharjeel was trying to pull this away, but it bounces a lot more than he expects. Hits his glove, then his hip and was amazingly taken by Shahzad
145 kph, fullish and just outside off stump, guided to point off the front foot
back of a length and outside off, steered behind point
141kph, shortish and outside off, cut away only as far as point
144 kph, shuffles across to protect his stumps as he blocks this back of a length delivery
loud grunt from the bowler as he releases this on middle and off, Shehzad is on his back foot and turns it away just wide and in front of mid-on
full and pushed across him, Shehzad strides forward and essays a picture perfect cover drive. Only he can't find the gap
fullish on middle and off, pushed to the left of the stumps at the bowler's end and they scurry through for a single

poor effort from the men at mid-off and mid-on. Both left it for the other to mop up, but since Shehzad had overrun at the strikers' end and could not capitalise. Another little nudge down the ground helps Pakistan rotate strike
back of a length on off stump, defended

took it on the up and this time he's pierced the gap in front of point! Elegant stroke gets deserved value. Not too bad a ball again and Shapoor is disappointed at the result it fetches. Shehzad though was admiring his square drive, as he should. Strong stride forward and a lovely flow of the bat through the line
strides forward to push this towards mid-off and sets off straight away
144kph, fullish on off stump, comes forward to block
opens the face to steer this length ball towards point. Pulled off his bottom hand to try and push it down to ground immediately
144 kph sublime! Another square drive, another boundary. This was struck behind point because Dawlat had offered just a hint more room
good length ball tucking him up on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
143kph, thumped to cover. He looks gorgeous off the front foot and isn't afraid to hit the ball on the up.
fullish and just outside off, a little more tentative to come forward to this length which robs the drive of timing. The bowler misfields but mid-off is on hand
134kph, slides this length ball down the leg side, Sharjeel evades
135kph, draws him forward but the drive is cut short at short cover
ducks back in off a length and Sharjeel was caught in his crease. But the umpire judges this was doing too much. Shehzad calls his partner through for a single
129kph, shortish on middle and leg, Shehzad waits on the back foot and nudges it behind square on the leg side
back of a length on off stump, shuffles and pushes to mid-on
fullish and angled in on off stump, Shajeel keeps it out
gets a top-edge, but it beats the man running back from midwicket. This was short and angled in at his body. Think he was into the shot a little late, possibly not expecting the ball to be dug in.
proves he's no mug on the leg side with a lovely flick through wide mid-on. The bowler strays a bit too straight and a bit too full. Easy pickings for subcontinental wrists
fullish and outside off, punched to short cover
137kph, full and nibbles away a touch, Shehzad gets forward and drives to mid-off
135kph, back of a length on off stump, steered to the man at short point
full toss on leg stump, Shehzad takes full toll. Clipped through midwicket and this is a very fast outfield. Yorker gone wrong
horrible end to the over, this is overpitched and slid down the leg side and all Shehzad had to do was tickle it away fine.
loopy delivery on off stump, Sharjeel digs it out behind square leg
hint of bounce as Shehzad goes back and absorbs it with soft hands.
lovey line as he concentrates on off stump. This is flighted to draw the batsman forwrad. Defended
skips down the track and nudges it to long-on. Gets off strike
this time he's spotted the batsman charging him and fires it on the pads. It is also not quite full enough to get under. Keeps the batsman to a defensive push
tossed up outside off, Sharjeel lunges and blocks expecting more turn. Gets an inside edge towards the leg side
tossed up on off stump, Shehzad is forward and pushes it back to the bowler
reaches the pitch of this flighted delivery on middle and drives towards mid-off. The bowler dives and intervenes
touch short which allows the batsman to go back and punch to short midwicket
shortish again as he rocks back and cuts straight to point
full and targets off stump, defended off the front foot
goes down the track and works this fuller delivery pushed on the pads behind square leg
this turns a bit outside off but Sharjeel works his wrists overtime. A ball others may have pushed into the covers goes to mid-on
turns from outside off as Shehzad goes back and punches towards mid-on. Nabi races across  and cuts the ball off
goes back and cuts into the covers. That time the fielder cannot stop the single, even if the batsman almost banged into each other
tossed up on middle and leg, there was a hint of turn but Sharjeel isn't too bothered. Lofts it over wide long-on and collects a boundary
uses his feet to get to the pitch and hoists him straight over his head. That's the fifty for Pakistan. Full-blooded strike after messing with the bowler's length. Lovely batting against spin
knows this will be shorter and he was waiting for it. Whipped wide of mid-on for a single
mild appeal for leg before but this has pitched well outside leg. Length ball catches Sharjeel in the crease again
good length ball on middle and leg, punched back to the bowler
fullish and wide of off stump, driven into the covers off the front foot
fullish on leg stump, solidly defended
nice and tight on middle stump, Sharjeel is forward and pushes to mid-off
opens the face to find the gap, almost shovels this full length delivery outside off stump between cover and mid-off
length ball on the pads, Sharjeel works it to short fine leg
hoicked away to deep midwicket as he charges down the track to get to the pitch of this fuller delivery on leg stump

slog sweep straight into the hands of deep midwicket! That's a terribly soft dismissal. This posed no threat to him, actually it flighted just a bit outside off and was in his arc. But Sharjeel just hasn't hit this well enough, especially with three men on the leg side boundary. Afghanistan have been very disciplined so far and they snare a deserved wicket, if not off the best ball
shortish and outside off, Hafeez uses the faint turn on that to steer it away to the sweeper
driven back to the bowler as this is given a bit of air on middle
teases him on off stump, but Shehzad's drive is solid enough as he beats the dive of the bowler and finds long-off
shortish on and around off stump, dabbed into the point region
fullish on off stump, think this skids onto him a touch. Hafeez manages to get his bat in line though
shortish and angled in on off stump, defended with soft hands and Shehzad is swift in spotting the opportunity for a single.
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
tight lines from Ashraf, which is important for a bowler of his pace. Keeps the batsman to a back foot defensive
steered to point as this is on a length outside off
well-timed late cut but the man at backward point is desperate enough to stop that.
tossed up on the stumps, defended
flighted on leg stump and it lures Shehzad into a sweep. Far too cramped for that shot to be too effective
holds this back a touch outside off, defended into the off side
loopy full toss, drifting down leg. This was the one to be swept away, but Shehzad doesn't pack enough punch on this. Only laps it wide of short fine leg
whoa! Where did this come from? Good flight from Hotak as he angles this in on middle. It grips the pitch and turns right across Hafeez's forward push
fullish outside off, pushed to long-off
targets the corridor as he lures the batsman forward to push into the covers
driven to mid-off as this is kept on off stump
did that stay low? Seemed like that with Hafeez's reaction. This was targeting off stump too. Just about kept out
full and angled in on middle, Hafeez pushes it past the bowler and rushes through for a single
Shehzad makes his own pace as he charges the medim-pacer and drives the length ball into the covers. Looks like it's drinks
tossed up outside off, lunge forward and chops to point
waits for and and dabs in front of point, but the fielder is a little too quick to allow the single. The captain himself there
flighted outside off and he pushes towards long-off. But Hotak races across and stops it himself
driven into the covers as this was given some air on off stump
defended into the covers and the bowler runs across to field it himself again. Loads of enthusiasm out there
shortish with the smallest bit of room, cut away but only as far as short third man. That's a maiden. Second of the innings
edged to deep third man as he defends inside the line of this length ball outside off. Very little motivation to move his feet
shuffles across to defend this shortish ball on off stump
length ball just outside off, Shehzad goes for a terrible slog over midwicket. That could easily have crashed into off stump
fullish and outside off, Shehzad was looking to pierce the gap in the covers but this holds up in the pitch and takes the inside edge to go down to mid-on
skips down the track and guides the length ball to the sweeper on the off side. Made a bit of room to envisage the shot
walks at him but the bowler isn't bothered. Keeps attacking the stumps and Hafeez's push is intercepted by mid-on. Only two off that over
pulls his length back as he sees the batsman charging him. Shehzad is confident enough to go through with his drive as he finds long-off
loads of flight on this one as Hafeez pushes to long-off
down the track again, but this is flatter and quicker. Defended into the covers
flays through extra cover having danced down the track. Made a little room for himself as he tried to power this away. Long-off cleans up
darted in on leg, Hafeez works to midwicket
lovely flight to finish the over as Hafeez presents a dead bat in front of the stumps
laps it over short fine leg and that's the first boundary since the 11th over. Fullish and angled in on the stumps, Shehzad plants his front foot outside off and beats the only fielder there
good length ball on the stumps, calmly defended
sneak a quick single as he dabs this length ball into the covers and runs
hoick through midwicket and the fielder in the deep botches it. This was off a very thick inside edge as he wanted to smear the length ball on off stump over long-on. He'll take the result though

taken at mid-off! Hafeez has played one slog too many! Another good length ball targeting top of off. The pressure generated by the Afghanistan bowlers over the past five overs shows as the batsman goes for another almighty swing. Only manages a leading edge which gives Nabi the easiest of catches
carved through point off the front foot as this length ball has a bit of room outside off. The throw from the deep is inaccurate and allows an extra run
shortish but this is on the stumps, punched down the ground
shortish again and this time he rocks back and cuts behind point. There is protection in the deep
tossed up on middle, Maqsood is forward and pushes to mid-off
lured him forward and this was uppishly driven towards extra cover
keeps it nice and tight on off stump, Maqsood keeps it out
turns a touch outside off and he uses it nicely. Opens the face of the bat to guide this fuller delivery through to the sweeper
fullish and angled on off stump, Maqsood defends off the front foot
short and wide, but Maqsood is not used to the pace of this pitch and gets an inside edge to this cut shot.
fullish and just outside off, defended off the front foot
back of a good length and outside off, Maqsood pushes to mid-off
full toss on off stump, Maqsood is too surprised to take full toll. Defended back to the bowler
litttle slower outside off, Maqsood punches into the covers and wanted the single but Shehzad denies him.
starts off with a yorker on off stump! Dug out

full toss on middle and leg, lovely little lap sweep goes to the left of the man at short fine leg. Hotak races after it and pulls out a desperate dive. But it ricochets off his palm, to the other, onto his face and then to the boundary
chips down the track and whips it away in front of square leg. Raises his fifty
good length ball on off stump, defended
stays leg side and carves this shorter delivery to point

strikes in his first over and another Pakistan batsman falls to a slog! Flatter delivery on the stumps, Shehzad clears his front leg and wanted to whack this to the next town. Gets an inside edge onto leg stump. Shenwari is pumped! Afghanistan on top!

complete mix-up! Absolute comedy out there as both batsmen end up at the same end! Maqsood reaches the pitch and drives this into the covers and sets off. His captain answers the call, but Maqsood then has second thoughts and while turning back, he slips. Races back to the batsman's with Misbah following him! The throw comes to the keeper, who runs the full 22 yards and breaks the stumps. Maqsood should have sacrificed himself and now Pakistan's best hope is gone
shortish on off stump, punched into the covers. Early call and they go through for a single
tossed up outside off, he was expecting this to turn a lot more. Plays inside the line and is beaten outside off
lunges forward and looks to push into the covers. Only inside edges for the ball to dribble by his feet
driven to long-on as he lunges forward to defend
oh, a bit of bounce! Leaps off a good length but Maqsood is on his back foot and gets on top of the bounce
cramps him for room on middle, but since this was flatter Akmal can rock back and punch straight of midwicket
muscled to the long-on boundary. This was tossed up on leg, Maqsood keeps his front leg out of the way and drills this down the ground. Raw power at work there
tossed up on the pads, Maqsood works this away towards midwicket
flighted outside off, driven down the ground to long-off
full toss and it almost carried to mid-on! The most non-threatening of deliveries and the batsman is lucky that he has not timed it properly. Just fell short of the forward-diving fielder
shortish and just outside off, rocks back to cut to point
gorgeous shot from Akmal. He took this almost off the gloves of the keeper as he late cuts it well fine of backward point
tossed up on middle and leg, Maqsood whips it away into the leg side
flighted on middle and leg, Akmal pushes to long-on
good length ball on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
belted over extra cover as he charged him and got under this flat but fuller delivery on middle. Lots of power to get it into the gap
shortish and pushed across him, Maqsood makes a bit of room and flat bats it to mid-off
lovely, probing line from the legspinner. This is just outside off and it turns further away. Akmal does well to defend with soft hands
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
pushed into the covers as this is flighted on middle and off
short and wide outside off, the cut shot can't beat Nabi at point

another for Shenwari as Maqsood perishes to mid-on! Flighted on off stump and he drags it towards the leg side. Doesn't bother to keep it down. It was only a matter of time considering he was hitting everything way too hard. Maqsood is completely out of sorts in this series. Meanwhile, Shenwari becomes the highest wicket-taker for Afghanistan
flatter and it turns from middle to outside off, Afridi punches through a diving extra cover fielder to long-off
hint of inswing there to the fuller delivery on middle. Afridi whips it to a very straight midwicket
bit of a fumble at long allows a second as Afridi flicks this length ball away with consummate authority
thumped to mid-on as this is fuller on middle and off.
chopped behind point as he sees a bit of width on this shortish ball
137kph, back of a length and just outside off. Akmal is cautious with his defence

fullish and sliding into the batsman. Yep, Dawlat is definitely getting the ball to reverse here. Akmal plays around his front pad and they go up in appeal for leg before. This would have gone down leg though
tossed up on off stump, Afridi lunges forward to defend between point and cover. Akmal does not want the single
lovely flight, and just the smallest hint of drift on. Afridi keeps his feet out of the way and drives to long-on
more work for long-off as Shenwari tosses this up outside off again
tossed up, drifted in and turns away. Lovely legspin bowling as Afridi defends
looks like I jinxed him. This was a long hop on middle and off, Afridi whips it wide of mid-on
reaches far forward and drives this flighted ball outside off through extra cover
worked to the right of midwicket as he waits for this length ball to come to him
back of a length and angled into Afridi. Nudged towards midwicket, no single there

you said it, JC. Slog over midwicket and the off stump is knocked off it's perch. This pitches on a good length outside off and darts in just a touch, Afridi employs one of his favourite shots and the result is no more a surprise. Afghanistan are ecstatic
shortish on off stump, Anwar gets in line and blocks
steered the shortish delivery outside off to deep third man
back of a length on off stump, Akmal dabs into the covers and they snare a quick single. Nicely judged, despite the momentary hesitation
short and way wide outside off. Akmal has to do a lot to restrain himself
tossed up outside off, driven into the covers
shortish on middle, clipped through midwicket
a little too much flight there as this is taken on the full and pushed to long-on
worked through midwicket as this is on a length and on middle

rips right across him! Shenwari, you beauty! Shahzad thinks he's stumped him here and we'll go to the third umpire. This drifted in, which fooled the batsman into a flick through leg. But the ball pitches and turns a mighty distance to beat the bat. Anwar was not properly balanced and Shahzad waits for his front foot to move outside the crease, but the back foot has not budged
this skids on straight and Shenwari is terribly disappointed. Akmal did excellently well to hurry into his defensive push and keep this from hitting the stumps, or his pads
pushed to extra cover as he lunges forward to the flighted ball outside off
shortish on off stump, rocks back to punch it past the bowler's dive to long-off
loopy delivery on off stump, defended
flighted on leg stump, nudges it to long-on
lovely line from the bowler as this is tossed up and drifts in on middle. Defended off the front foot
just a touch short and it is enough for Akmal to cut it fine to short third man
tossed up outside off, lunges forward to defend
this time his drive goes down to the fielder at deep extra cover
nudged away to deep square leg as this is dropped a bit short and on the pads
low full toss on off stump, driven with a straight bat to long-off
drifts in as he tosses this up on middle and leg. Struck on the pads as he defends. Would have slid down leg
tossed up on leg stump, Anwar was making some room to drive to long-off but gets an inside edge. That's drinks
flighted outside off, Akmal presses forward to defend
goes forward to the tossed up delivery on middle and keeps it out
lures him outside off but Akmal is tight as he drives to long-off

misfield at mid-on allows Pakistan a very dearly needed boundary. Mangal was the man who dived over that. Anwar was making room to punch it and gets just enough pat to push this through to the boundary
stayed back and blocks this good length ball
tossed up on middle and off, defended. Wanted a single, but is sent back
flighted on middle and off, defended towards point
lovely, friendly full toss wakes up the Pakistan contingent as Akmal flays this over long-on! Clean strike, much needed strike
flighted on the pads, easily worked through square leg
opens the face and guides this tossed up delivery to point. No single there
turn outside off to beat the late cut. He went chasing at it and could easily have guided it straight to the keeper's gloves.
flighted on off stump, driven to long-off
flighted on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler. Anwar keeps taking a few steps out of his crease where there are no singles to be had
punched to long-on as this was shorter on off stump
bit of width but Akmal's late cut goes straight to short third man
flighted on middle and leg, turned away to midwicket
a bit fuller for that late cut and Akmal is beaten. Admonishes himself by banging his bat on his helmet
rocks back and short-arm pulls towards wide long-on
guides this shortish delivery outside off to deep third man. Neatly done
draws him forward as this is angled across him, Anwar pushes into the covers and for the first time today says "wait".
137 kph, lures Anwar to play away from his body. That was very dangerous. Might just have straightened off the fuller length leaving him poking at it
fullish and angled in at him, Anwar's defence is far more tighter as they scamper a single in front of point

dropped square on the off side by Shenwari! This was a fuller delivery outside off and Akmal swung across the line, trying to exploit the gap at square leg. The leading edge hands in the air for a very long time and when it came down it bursts right through the fielder's hands. Akmal is on his honches at the non-strikers'. He knows that was a terrible shot
back of a length and outside off, left alone
direct hit from short fine leg and the third umpire's called in to adjudicate. He's safe though. His head was down and he was sliding his bat. Good technique. Neat little nudge to get off strike
flighted outside off, defended into the covers
drags it short, but the turn ensures there isn't enough width to take advantage. Pushed back to the bowler
clipped into the midwicket region as this is on a length on middle and leg
gorgeous stroke. That's why he sets himself straight after playing horrid slogs. It was flighted outside off and Akmal was forward and eases this through extra cover. What timing!
and the late cut. He's beaten backward point who chases it down and keeps it to two. Just a hint of room on this shortish delivery and Akmal's been quite adept at that stroke
142 kph, back of a length just outside off, opens the face to guide it to point
ventures forward to steer this good length ball outside off to deep third man
138kph, back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
135kph, good length ball angling in on middle, Akmal stays in line and blocks
141kph, fullish and outside off, Anwar lunges forward and lets it go
misfield at backward point allows for what could have been a tight single into an easy one. Nicely waited on and guided away
flighted on off stump, defended off the front foot
flatter and quicker on off stump, pushed to long-on
tossed up on leg stump, driven only as far as the bowler
punched wide of long-on as this is shortish on middle and off
long-on has a bit more work as this is flat on middle and leg
last ball of the powerplay is thumped between point and cover. Short again and this time it had enough width for Anwar to go deep into his crease and cut it away powerfully
full and wide of off stump, Akmal leans into a cover drive. Can't find the gap
good length ball on off stump, dabbed in front of point and calls for the single immediately. There's a bit of a misfield and Akmal is wise to it as he sneaks in a second

carted over mid-on to bring up the fifty partnership. Akmal has begun to open up! Charges the medium pacer and though he pitched it shorter, the batsman is comfortable enough to go through with the loft. Good shot
nudged in front of midwicket as Ashraf targets middle and leg
waits for the back of a length ball on off stump and steers to short third man
short and wide outside off, Anwar cuts under the ball and misses
flighted outside off, Akmal is forward and blocks. Hint of drift away and some turn after pitching too
keeps bat and pad close as he keeps this tossed up delivery out
flatter on off stump, pushed to long-on
dabbed with soft hands towards point and they rush through for a single
shortish and outside off, cut straight to point
worked away wide of long-on as this is flighted on middle stump
bit of room outside off and he carves it to short third man
gets on top of the bounce of this shortish ball outside off and guides this to deep third man. Good running fetches them two
fullish and outside off, Anwar is walking into this as he drives to cover

skips down the track and lofts over extra cover, but Nawroz Mangal has made a spectacular run and grabs it in front of his body! The bowler had spotted him charging and dragged the length short. His pace is not enough to bother Anwar into changing his shot though as he swings with an open face. It goes high and the man had to race a long way to his left from mid-off, had his eyes on the ball all the way through and sticks his hands out at the perfect time to snag it safely
fullish on off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended
reverses in on middle and off, gets an inside edge to long leg. Tough ball first up for Gul, but he does very well

shortish and outside off, guided away to deep third man to record his second consecutive fifty. Feigns keeping for an imaginary ball for the dressing room's benefit. Pakistan still need him out there though, but they owe a lot of their total to this man
back of a length on off stump, blocked
fullish on off stump, comes forward to block with a straight bat
good length ball sneaking down leg. Strikes the pad and wanders towards midwicket. No point in that appeal
clipped in front of square leg and he takes on the fielder in the deep and succeeds easily
short and directed at Gul's abdomen, swivel pulls it down to long leg to get off strike
fullish and angled in on off stump, Akmal opens the face but can't beat backward point

whacked through the vacant midwicket region. Strange field considering he is bowling around the wicket. It's a length ball well outside off but Akmal has walked into this and whipped it through to the boundary. Powerful strike
tapped in front of point as this is just a bit too short and outside off
back of a length on off stump, safely defended
clipped to deep square leg as he goes fuller on middle and off. Lovely timing there from Gul
think that slipped out of his hand. Hip-high full toss on leg stump and Gul does well to punch it to long-on
that is glorious. He was walking at the bowler, so Dawlat shortens his length but has made the mistake of giving him too much room. Akmal slaps it through point and has struck it just about perfectly
walks at him again, this time though there isn't as much room on offer. Guided behind point with a straighter bat.
full on middle and leg. He was looking to flick it through midwicket, but gets an inside edge onto pad
full and angling in at him, flicked through midwicket as the fielder lets it through him. Neat timing from Akmal
yorker on off stump, hint of reverse there as well. Akmal stays leg side of it. Pushed into the covers for a quick single. Safe despite the direct hit
shortish and just outside off, makes room and pushes into the covers with an open face
walks at him again and though Shapoor digs it in, he goes through with a hack. It's needed at this stage of the innings and he manages to evade mid-off. That brings up 200 for Pakistan
110 kph, slower ball but picked up Akmal. Pushed down to long-on for a single

too early into the short-armed pull and he goes a bottom edge down to third man. Akmal wants the strike and he succeeds. Lovely running, oh... actually there was a possibility of a run-out at the non-strikers'
another slower ball on the pads. Akmal was looking to nudge it to long leg, but he is fooled by the change up.
135kph, rides the pace and bounce on this to guide the shortish ball outside off to deep third man
full toss on middle, those yorkers aren't quite landing recently for Dawlat. Punched back to the bowler
low full toss on middle and leg, drilled to long-on who has a bit of distance to cover. Pulls out a dive and keeps it to two
137kph, there's the yorker on leg stump, turned to midwicket
swats it over midwikcet! That was imperious from Umar Gul! Digs it in short and it's just what the batsman wanted as he camps on the back foot and pummels it. That gets a smile from Misbah
even better! This time straight down the ground! Searches for the yorker, but offers up a full toss. Gul meets it with a straight bat and lofts right over the bowler's end

castled! You miss, I hit says Dawlat. It was fullish and Gul was a little rooted on leg stump as he swung for the fences again. This time though the ball seems to have ducked in the smallest bit to beat him and crash into the stumps
charges him and this is a length ball, not the best choice in the death overs. Akmal gets it off the bottom of the bat but still it has enough power to sail over the long-on boundary
116 kph, slower ball but it was on a length and sliding down leg. They're losing their discipline in the face of Akmal's attack. Flicked away to the long leg boundary
low full toss on off stump, powered to mid-off. Struck so hard that it bursts through him and they take a single
130kph, full and angled in on leg stump, flicked away to deep midwicket
low full toss, and again the drive finds mid-off. Akmal throws his head back in disappointment.
almost a yorker outside off, dug out to long-on as Akmal retains strike for the last over
flat-batted straight down the ground but long-on's desperation is enough to keep it to two. Another knee-high full toss
very full on middle, but the bottom-handed power in this shot is something to behold. Long-on races to his left and dives, but is not enough to stop this from crossing the boundary
full-toss over waist high and sliding down leg too! Possibly everything that can go wrong with a ball as Akmal smacks it to the long leg boundary. Racing towards his century and Pakistan eye 250!
full and outside off, thumped to long-on. Refuses the single. Ajmal is not quite pleased with that as he walks up to have a chat
full toss outside off, slapped to deep point. Still no single

that's his century! Akmal is beside himself as he hops and skips all the way to the non-strikers' it was a length ball with loads of room outside off, Akmal slogs it 96m into the stands behind long-on.
another leg stump full toss and Akmal whips it to deep square leg and has to settle for a single.

inn2.comm: whipped to the right of square leg! No need for footwork when he has wrists like that! It was full on middle and leg and the timing on that made me sit up and take notice.
good length ball targeting the stumps, Shahzad is back behind it and blocks. Hint of away movement there
took a couple of steps after he tucked this away to midwicket. Noor Ali was almost halfway down the pitch and would have been out had that been a direct hit
good length ball on off stump, guided to backward point
jumps in his crease and presents half an face as he guides this length ball towards point
flicked between midwicket and mid-on. He's very strong when the ball is on his pads
slides down the leg side and the other Afghanistan opener gets off the mark with a boundary too. Picked away to the long leg boundary and the man in the deep was a little too fine to contest this
lovely reply from the bowler! Fullish again, but this time it was outside off and draws Noor Ali into a lazy waft outside off. Beaten
clipped off his toes with the angle. Afghanistan are motoring here. Touch too full, touch too straight ant put away rather handsomely through the gap wide of mid-on
punched into the covers off the back foot as this is on a length and outside off
edged, but there is only one slip in place. It was back of a length and outside off. Noor Ali pokes with hard hands and it flies away through were third slip might have been
fullish on middle, Shahzad evades three men on the leg side field to pick up a couple. Too well timed for short midwicket and placed it wide of mid-on
fullish and outside off, driven to mid-off
terrific delivery! Fullish and outside off, holds its line and leaves Noor Ali poking at one outside off.
what an answer! This is just a bit shortish and Noor Ali has pounced. Lovely full face striking it at the top of the bounce and this races through extra cover
a bit too excited there as they search for a single after the length ball is hit to mid-on. That's Anwar Ali, Pakistan's best fielder
back of a length outside off, steered towards backward point
finds short cover with a back-foot punch. This was a good length ball on off stump
he's off his feet again, clipping the length ball off his pads to deep midwicket
137 kph, fullish on off stump, kept out on the back foot
132kph, back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away behind square leg
137 kph, not enough room to justify that cut shot, which is why he gets a bit of an inside edge. Not too much footwork from Shahzad, seems to survive on hand-eye coordination
141 kph, fullish on off stump. Comes forward to block
140kph, fullish and pushed across him, Shahzad goes for another cut but doesn't connect
opens the face, but he can only steer this shortish ball outside off straight to point
oh, he's excellent off that back foot! This is punched between point and cover with elan! Stood up tall to get on top of the bounce and thumps it away. Umar Akmal is at the bowler's ear
133 kph, bouncer on middle and leg, Noor Ali has hurry as he ducks
140kph, the short ball goes down leg this time and Noor Ali helps it away. Swivels on the back foot and pulls to the left of long leg.
protects his off stump with a little shuffle and nudges this length ball outside off past midwicket. More of an inside edge there

131 kph, nicked off says umpire Billy Bowden! Shehzad though is looking at his bat and is staring back. Terrific delivery though as this back of a length delivery gains a little more bounce. Far too much for that back foot punch and Umar Akmal pouches an easy catch. He was playing away from his body and this delivery straightened nicely. But did he edge it though? I'm not really sure
fullish on off stump, defended to short cover
pushed to mid-on as this is on a good length on middle and leg
steered into the covers as this is fuller on middle and off. Played from the crease
length ball on the pads, picked away to long leg
142kph, short ball on middle and leg. Hurried onto him a little too quickly as he gets an inside edge to his intended pull stroke
punched to extra cover as this length ball is angled across him
fullish and angling in at him, clipped rather solidly to midwicket

gets this one to straighten again, but the edge dies on the keeper! Lovely line from Gul here as he targets off stump and gets it to dart away after pitching. Noor Ali is squared up and is lucky the edge doesn't carry

fullish and outside off, Stanikzai is forward trying to defend. But he is too tentative and plays inside the line. Took off from the pitch and thuds into the keeper's gloves. Too good for him too as slip gets the rebound
back of a length outside off, defended
leading edge, but it was never going to reach mid-on. He's not at all comfortable out there. Too early into flicking this shortish ball on middle and it lobs straight up in the air
good length ball, which moves away outside off. Left alone
flicked from the crease to midwicket as this is fullish on leg stump
he hit one through the covers, then through point and now through extra! The punch off the back foot is reaping big dividends for Noor Ali
114kph, slower ball on a length and just outside off, eased behind point with an angled bat
fullish on middle and off, defended to short midwicket
shortish on off stump, Stanikzai stands up tall and blocks
fullish on middle and leg, flicked into the midwicket region
136 kph, walks at him as Gul shortens his length. Nudged uppishly through midwicket but the area is vacant
whipped behind square leg as he takes a few steps at the bowler again. Dug in short again, but this is more on his hips to enable the shot
good length ball straightens on off stump, defended with an open face
back of a length and outside off, guided to point
fullish and a bit too straight, clipped just wide of mid-on
tucked away off his hips just square of midwicket
fullish and angled in on off stump, driven to mid-off quite confidently
short and continues on with the angle, whipped to short midwicket
117kph, slower ball outside off, waits for it and steers to point
tapped to point again as he finishes the stroke with a whip of his wrists. Junaid persists back of a length and outside off
looks for the cut, but not enough room. Inside edges the length ball into the covers
142kph, stayed low on middle and the dead bat keeps it out. Maiden from Junaid
good length ball on off stump, pushes to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
beaten outside off! He's back to his probing best outside that off stump. Stanikzai was caught in the crease as he fishes with an angled blade. No luck
back of a length on and around off stump, steered to point with half a bat
shortish on middle and leg, worked to short midwicket

bottom edge as this back of a length ball outside off doesn't rise as high as he expects. Immediately whips around to see if his stumps are okay and sees the ball wandering away towards deep third man
flatter on middle, goes back and punches to long-on
102kph, length ball, pushed through on off stump. He's a little slow on the back foot punch and gets an inside edge onto pad
101 kph, flatter and quicker again but this time he's better prepared and flicks to midwicket
flighted outside off, steered behind point of the front foot
full on off stump, this was 100 kph too. Has to hurry into the defensive push
fires this down the leg side and the batsman's flick is too slow
good length ball on off stump, punched to short cover
still struggling with his lines here and the length ball on the pads is tickled away to the long leg boundary
fullish on middle and leg, worked to short midwicket
punched to short cover as this is on a length and outside off
full on off stump, leans forward and drives to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, blocked in front of point
full and drifting in on leg stump, driven to long-on
flighted outside off, pushed just wide of extra cover. Hesitation from the non-striker but only a direct hit could have hurt him
pushed through full on leg stump, turned away between square leg and midwicket
room outside off and he tried to flay it through point. Hafeez and point does well in getting a hand to it as he dives to his right
slides on with the arm. Stanikzai was on the back foot and manages to tuck it behind square leg quite nicely
this turns into him! This was quick and full and he just manages an inside edge while trying to flick it away.
slapped towards the cover boundary but there is a man in the deep. Again, looked very eye-catching when striking the ball off the back foot
length ball on off stump keeps rather low. Stanikzai's defence though is equal to the task.
short on off stump and he wants a very tight single! Misbah takes aim but cannot throw down the stumps. Stanikzai was ball-watching there and is lucky to survive
clipped to long leg as this is full and bowled on the pads
slower ball outside off, pushed to mid-off

fullish on middle and off. Hit uppishly down the ground, but too far to the right of short midwicket for that to be called a chance. Was walking into the shot and employed the flick way too early there
flighted and angled in on middle, defended off the front foot
this one skids on after pitching on a good length. Stanikzai is on the back foot as he makes some room and manages to get his bat down in time
flighted outside off and this gets a hint of turn, driven towards the covers

struck on the pads and he was in front of middle too! But this was struck on the top flap of the pad. Too quick from Afridi and the batsman was playing across the line as well. HawkEye says it clips the stumps and would have stayed with umpire's call
bit of width outside off and nudged into the covers
pitched shorter this time and he goes back to punch down the ground and that will be drinks
floats the slower ball on middle, defended down the ground
short and wide, rocks back and cuts but it goes straight to point. All these dot balls are weighing on him here
plays across a full-length delivery and is struck on the pads. Would have gone down leg though. Only a mild appeal. That was a cross-seamer from Anwar
fullish on off stump, strides forward and blocks to mid-off
offcutter, dragged a bit shortish and outside off. Punched to mid-off
short and he puts it away to the left of midwicket. Ample power in the stroke and this time he finds the gap
quick and flat outside off, looks to cut and only gets an inside edge
102kph, pushed through full on middle and leg, driven to mid-on
89kph, think that is the slowest he's bowled today. And gets a bit of turn. Defended off the front foot
103 kph, followed by the quickest of the lot which slides into him. He's too slow on the flick and is struck on the pads. That was sliding down leg though.
driven to long-on as this is full on middle
tossed up on middle and off, draws the batsman forward as he defends
impact was outside the line of off as he goes for a lap sweep straight up. Tossed up outside off and it turns in to strike him on the thigh pad

another loud appeal for leg before but Billy says "no". Think that turned a bit too much. Noor Ali was playing across the line there as he looked to flick square instead of pushing straight. It did pitch outside off
flighted on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
shortish on middle and leg, punched to mid-on

this time he's trapped in front. Ajmal has struck in his first over! Struck low on the front pad as this turns in from outside the off stump. He was trying to play around his pads again and this time he pays the price.
goes for a lap sweep too and the ball comes off his bat and strikes his grille. Lovely flight from Ajmal as he targets a middle and off line
fullish and flat on leg stump, turned away to short midwicket
goes on with the arm again and the batsman is punches it to mid-on. Not convincingly though
full on middle and leg, driven into the extra cover region. Tried to make a bit of room there
good length ball on the stumps, Stanikzai is behind it
drifting down leg with the fuller ball and this is picked away to deep square leg
tossed up outside off and he leans into a drive to cover
plays with the turn as he picks up a single through midwicket
short leg is a good position as the batsman lunges forward to block. Appreciable turn here
doosra and he had no clue about it. Pokes outside off and there is miles of daylight between bat and pad.
flighted on off stump, reaches forward and clips to midwicket
this time he beats the only man inside the circle on the leg side and takes a single to long-on
another doosra, tossed up outside off. He was looking to flick into the leg side having not picked it up. Gets a leading edge through point. Ajmal has a wry smile
quick and flat on off stump, goes back and pushes to the bowler
flighted on middle and leg, strides forward to defend
82kph, this one rips across as he floats the ball up with considerably more flight than usual. The batsman adjusts well as he defends with an open face

concerted appeal as this quicker, flatter delivery hits him on the pads. The batsman was looking to flick too square but this would have missed leg stump. Actually, HawkEye says it would have clipped the stumps, but the decision would have stayed. The dreaded umpire's call
fullish on middle and leg, strides out to defend and gets an onside edge
tossed up outside off, driven down the ground to long-off

I think he's short of his ground here! Risky single to square leg and the third umpire has been called in to help. Nope, my eyes are useless. He's well in. This was turning off a good length and he rode it quite nicely.
tossed up on off stump, nicely driven to long-on
tossed up on off stump, flicked to short midwicket
turns right past the face of the bat as he goes to flick.
thought this would turn more and Afghanistan would get another extra. This time the length was a little shorter and strikes him on the thigh
tossed up on middle, kept out
comes down the track and whips to the left of square leg, who is quite alert as he runs across and dives to keep it to a single
pushed through and this turns into the batsman as well. Mangal is too late on his flick
flighted on off stump, defended off the front foot

tossed up on middle and leg, flicks to midwicket and was outside his crease when the throw came on and strikes the stumps. Akmal, the wicketkeeper likes it. But replays show the batsman had made his ground
103kph, drifts in on off stump as Mangal comes forward and blocks
a bit slower and this is nudged into the midwicket region
drifting into the batsman off a fuller length, hit to midwicket again
all at sea against the doosra. Goes for a sweep to the tossed up delivery outside off. Deflects off the glove and ricochets onto his body
nudged behind square leg as he plays this tossed up delivery on off with the turn
another doosra and the batsman was poking again. Thought it was the offspinner and there is loads of distance between bat and pad as he misses a good length ball outside off
very late on this tossed up offspinner. Those doosra's have had their effect. Inside edges this towards midwicket as he plays off the back foot
floats it up outside off as he drives to short cover. They'r being beaten or finding the fielders here.
nudged to long leg as Ajmal drops this a little shorter than his usual probing length
starts off with a full toss outside off and the batsman goes for a sweep. Bump ball to square leg, but Shehzad plays the crowd as he tosses the ball up in the air
flighted outside off, steered to third man with an open face
clipped to long leg as this is on a length and on middle
tossed up on middle and turned away to midwicket
vociferous appeal for leg before as this is flighted on off stump. Little too much turn on that occasion as the batsman is struck on the pads after preferring to play a little too square.
skips down the track and slogs to long-on
gets his radar right straight away. Good length ball on off stump keeps the batsman honest
keeps it tight on middle and off, defended from the crease

charges him and whacks the length ball straight down the ground. At last some intent from Afghanistan. First boundary in nine overs and it's a good one. Head down and eyes on the ball as he thumped it
slower ball beats him. Very clever bowling from Gul. Tried to adjust and tuck it away off his pads but doesn't succeed
short and outside off, allowed through to the keeper
short ball angled in at the batsman who ducks under it
turns the good length ball on middle straight to square leg

charges down the track with merry abandon and swings for all he's worth, but he's completely missed it. Was expecting the offspinner, but this straightens. Should have been stumped, but the keeper had got up too quickly and the ball scurries in between his legs
length ball pushed through on middle and leg, worked to square leg
punched to long-on as this is shortish and on middle and off
shortish and on middle again, whips it through midwicket
a lot slower as he targets off stump. The batsman waits and then punches with hard hands straigh to fielder at mid-on.
back of a length and outside off, steered with an angled bat to point. They just can't manoevre the ball around
punched through the covers as this is back of a length and outside off.
full and wide outside off, he throws his bat at it and skews it off an inside edge to long-on
back of a length on off stump, was looking to whip it away through midwicket and gets a leading edge into the covers. They've been far too fond of that stroke today
searching for the yorker, ends up a low full toss on leg stump. Whipped to deep square leg
uses the bowler's pace there as he upper cuts him right over the keeper. Nicely done as he sway inside the line and his wrists supply enough power and keep it fine of deep third man
goes forward to defend this good length ball which skids into him
skips down the track and nudges this length ball to long-on
short and straying down leg, heaved away to long leg to bring up the Afghanistan hundred
closes the face too early but the leading edge falls short of Anwar Ali at cover. Cannot pick the doosra again and he almost perished. Lovely flight from Hafeez
quicker and flatter on middle. Goes back to pull, but he's beaten by the pace
slides the good length ball down the leg side
short on middle, tucked away to the right of midwicket
bit of width outside off, but his timing is all wrong. Gets an inside edge while he looks to cut with lead feet
steers this short delivery outside off to deep third man
punched to cover off the back foot as this is short of a good length and angled in on off stump
slapped over mid-off! He had the room to go for the stroke and ensures this short ball is sent to the boundary. Not the best ball from one of the better bowlers with the old ball
111kph, that's better, change of pace from Junaid beats him. Looked to defend with an open face and sneak a quick single but he doesn't connect
short ball, went for the pull. Low percentage shot considering he had to fetch it from well outside off. Beaten
short and sliding down leg as he pulls to deep backward square leg. Hit in the air, but doesn't carry to Maqsood
flighted on middle, very little turn for Hafeez as the batsman tucks him around behind square leg
full and fired down the leg side. Went for a sweep, but it was too quick and too full
short and had enough room to be belted to the deep midwicket boundary. There is protection there
rides the turn to flick the good length ball to long leg
flighted on middle, nudges to the left of midwicket
length ball, worked to square leg and has forgotten there is a fielder there. Has to rush back and makes it
fullish and outside off, dragged towards long-on
back of a length and outside off, steered to deep third man. This partnership has crossed fifty now, but has taken over 80 balls
slammed through the covers as Junaid floats this outside off stump. Sweeper cleans up
short ball outside off, Stanikzai looks for an upper cut but this bounces a bit more than he expects
137kph, fullish and it stays a bit low. The bottom of the bat takes another battering

walks at him but Junaid digs it in short. Goes for pull shot but it was too wide for him to connect. Akmal fails to get his body in line with this even as it dies on him and looks forlorn as he allows a few byes
flighted on off stump, leans forward to defend to midwicket
flatter and on leg stump, clipped through mdiwicket
short and with a bit of room outside off, rocks back and thumps it to long-on
flighted on middle and leg, eased to the left of midwicket
length ball on the stumps, worked away but only as far as square leg.
really should have been forward to this one as it was tossed up outside off. Still manages to keep it out though. That will be drinks
goes wide of the crease and pushes this is short and outside off, cut into the covers

tossed up outside off and he goes for a slog sweep. Gets a top-edge which goes high into the air. Ajmal runs in from long leg and dives forward, but I don't think he could even get a hand to that. Dropped!
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
skips down the track and works this fuller delivery angling into him towards deep midwicket
loads of turn here for Afridi, but the batsman has adjusted well. Plays with an angled bat and has used soft hands to sneak a single. That's been a rarity
driven square on the off side as he lunges forward to this flighted legspinner outside off
flighted on off stump and that draws the batsman out of his crease. Slogged to long leg
oh, this is lovely placement! Makes use of the room outside off and carves square of short third man. Good stride forward too!
goes for the doosra again and the batsman does not know head or tail of it. It was hit on the back leg. Big appeal but perhaps it was high. Nope, HawkEye says that would hit middle!
another doosra and this bounces appreciably too. Afghanistan have not picked a single doosra in this match as Mangal closes the face and looks to flick into the midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven into the covers off the front foot. Hard hands, but can't find the gap
short and wide, poor ball from Afridi and this is cut too fine for short third man to contain. Afghanistan are not giving up
tossed up on off stump, driven into the covers
good length ball outside off, beaten
driven back to the bowler as this is pushed quick and full on middle
opens the face and sneaks a single between point and cover. Slower from Afridi and nicely guided

leading edge goes straigh to point! Stanikzai's trouble vigil at the crease finally ends and Afridi is just relieved that he has contributed today. It was pushed full and down the leg side. The batsman was charging him, having made his own room and tried to whip it away through the leg side. But he's deceived
tossed up on off stump. Another doosra not picked as he played across the line. Struck a bit too high on the back pad

oh dear, another mix-up as Nabi charged down the pitch after the keeper fumbled his take of this delivery fired down the leg side. Mangal though was far more tentative and by the time he decided to get his motor running, the throw is in from short fine leg and he's comfortably short of his ground. Mangal pays for ball-watching
good length ball on middle and off. Blocked off the front foot
another quick single into the covers but this time it was better judged. Played with soft hands and the non-striker was quick to respond and dived into the crease
tossed up outside off and this grips and turns and bounces as well. Najibullah is beaten comfortably
tossed up outside off and he leaves this alone
doosra and the left-hander cannot pick it as well, lunging forward to defend and takes the inside edge to run down to midwicket
shortish and outside off, cut into the covers
tossed up outside off and he lunges forward to defend
inside edges it down to short fine leg. The non-striker wanted the single and has to hurry back.
stays back to the length ball on off stump, defended towards backward point
lovely little dab which is too fine for short third man. Saw the width on this tossed up delivery and takes advantage

oh, he's pulled it off again. This time there was a little more pace on the ball but Nabi likes that as he goes forward and presents an angled bat. Just slides off the face and scurries off to the third man boundary
punched to short cover as this is on a length and outside off
slides on with the arm as he goes back and punches the length ball wide of mid-on. Afghanistan have made 150
skips down the track, but Hafeez shortens his length and keeps the batsman to a push to midwicket
tucked away through the vacant square leg area as this is shortish and on middle and off

chopped onto his stumps and Najibullah just stands there in disappointment. Goes for the cut as he sees this a bit shortish and outside off, but the ball stays a bit low and the inside edge does him in.
tossde up outside off and this is hit uppishly into the covers and he manages to evade the man inside the circle
drilled through extra cover. Picked the slower ball and tucked into it. This had too much room and was overpitched too. Easy pickings
low full toss, curling in on off stump. Picked away to deep square leg
smears this almost yorker-length ball outside off to the man sweeping on the boundary

ducks back in off a good length and Nabi was caught in the crease while trying to flick through midwicket. Umpire Bowden shakes his head first but then raises his old crooked finger. The batsman is shocked, but he has to walk back. No bat on that and I think that might just have clipped leg stump, by a feather says HawkEye
indipping yorker on middle and leg, whipped away to deep square leg
pushed to long-on as this is on a length and on middle
flighted on off stump, but he prefers to stay back and punch to long-on
lovely flighted just outside off as he comes forward to block
bit of room outside off and he chops it to point
tossed up outside off and he leans forward for a flick which just about evades the outstetched right hand of Hafeez
good length ball on off, worked to short midwicket
clipped to short fine leg as he shuffles across to ride what little turn is there on this shortish ball that keeps low.
reverse sweep as Shewari takes the attack to Ajmal. A bit of innovation results in a lovely boundary to third man
quicker and flatter on off stump, gets an inside edge as he goes for a cut. Direct hit from short fine leg, but the batsman is home. Billy doesnt even go up to the third ump
tossed up outside off and this turns the other way, as ever the Afghanistan batsmen do not pick it. Beaten outside off
short and turning into him as he goes back for a late cut even if there is a slip in place. Drops just short of him
doosra, bowled short enough for the batsman to read it off the pitch and dabs it to third man
the straighter one is tossed up this time and Shenwari's forward defensive searches for the ball to no avail
flighted on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
bit short and has enough room for him to guide it away, but only as far as backward point
goes back to the length ball and dabs it back to the bowler. Bit of a leading edge as he was looking to flick across the line again
flighted outside off, pushed to long-on
short and pushed down the leg side. Goes for the pull, but this skids on without bouncing much

terrible misunderstanding results in yet another run out. This was dabbed in front of point and he takes a couple of strides as he going for the single and then stops. By that time the non-striker was halfway down and he isn't even in the picture as Junaid sends the throw in to the bowler
off goes the middle stump as the doosra finally fetches a wicket. He was lunging down the wrong line and of this flighted ball beats the outside edge by a considerable distance
flighted outside off stump and this one turns too. The tailender goes for a forward defensive, but is no match
lunges forward to defend this tossed up straighter one. Bounces more and hits him quite high on the bat. But midwicket is too deep
shortish and outside off, goes back and cuts towards third man
lunges forward to defend the tossed up delivery on off stump with an open face
flighted on middle and leg, defended
gets a bit of turn as he pushes this through on middle and leg. Brushes the pad and goes towards short fine leg
lunges forward to defend the tossed up ball on off stump. Gets an inside edge to mid-on
charges down the pitch for an almight slog, another inside edge which runs down to deep square leg
goes back to a fuller delivery outside off. Doesn't turn much and he's beaten. Umar Akmal fumbles another take
full and flat on off stump, defended

rank slog over midwicket manifests as a leading edge and Ajmal snares a catch at point. Tossed up delivery angled in on off stump. Wasn't to the pitch of it as he swings away as most No.10s do and has to walk back
flighted on off stump, defended
flighted doosra on off stump, too good for Shenwari. Lunges forward to defend and he's beaten again
tossed up on middle and turns into leg. He's struck on the pads, but that might have missed leg. Was playing down the wrong line again as he tried to protect himself against the doosra
gets loads of bounce off the straighter one which goes right across him. Hotak pushes and is beaten
shuffles across to protect his stumps and defends this flighted ball with an open face
flighted on middle and off, kept out
knocks middle of middle and Pakistan have got the bonus point to go top of the table in this Asia Cup. Length ball keeps low as he looks to pull. Sneaks under the bat and then it's timber!
